config.question: Which of the following best explains the delay in issuing the Emancipation Proclamation by Abraham Lincoln?

choices.content: By announcing emancipation early, Lincoln stood to lose the support of abolitionists and the strongly antislavery Republicans.
Announcing emancipation early would have made the North appear desperate and vulnerable.
Lincoln was keen to give the southern states time to rejoin the Union.
By announcing emancipation early, Lincoln stood to lose the support of abolitionists and the strongly antislavery Republicans.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Lincoln issued his Emancipation Proclamation in the immediate aftermath of General McClellan’s success at the fiercely-fought battle of Antietam. Most Republican politicians were now committed to emancipation, and many were on the verge of repudiating the administration for its inaction. See L.O. 15.3 How did the Union finally attain victory, and what role did emancipation play in it?
